intro: Perymenium nicaraguense, commonly known as the Nicaraguan perymenium, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in yellow or orange. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with ecological significance in its native habitat.
